html: 10.16.19  8:50 pm   This is so exciting. Earlier tonight I was walking home and the traffic light pole had its little trapdoor open and there was a power switch for the traffic lights! There was also another switch labeled "automatic/manual" that probably had to do with a handheld button similar to the ones you see on Jeopardy! that would have allowed me to control the lights. The button was connected with a 1/4-inch plug like on serious headphones audiophiles buy for thousands of dollars. That was so neat! Of course I didn't touch anything because I don't want to be responsible for any car accidents. Have you ever had a similar experience?

html: 10.16.19  12:50 pm   Technically Oxygen and Hydrogen have the wrong names, as Oxygen means "Acid-forming" whilst Hydrogen means "Water-forming" and the name Oxygen was given when it was believed that all acids had Oxygen in them, and as Hydrogen was discovered by splitting water, it was given the name Hydrogen. Now, it is now known that all acids actually contain Hydrogen (Hydrochloric Acid or HCl has no Oxygen) so what we call Hydrogen should actually be called Oxygen and thus what we call Oxygen should actually be called Hydrogen. Opinions?
original_html: 10.16.19  12:50 pm   Technically Oxygen and Hydrogen have the wrong names, as Oxygen means "Acid-forming" whilst Hydrogen means "Water-forming" and the name Oxygen was given when it was believed that all acids had Oxygen in them, and as Hydrogen was discovered by splitting water, it was given the name Hydrogen. Now, it is now known that all acids actually contain Hydrogen (Hydrochloric Acid or HCl has no Oxygen) so what we call Hydrogen should actually be called Oxygen and thus what we call Oxygen should actually be called Hydrogen. Opinions?
